feed.title: Abe Lincoln's Top Hat (Only new eps)
feed.subtitle: Politics! We know you love them just as much as we do. Join political commentator Ben Kissel and radio man Marcus Parks each week as they discuss what's going on in politics and the world of social issues.

entry.title: Episode 513: Hubba Hubba Politics
entry.content: Ben and Travis recap the VP debates and discuss the attempted abduction of Gov. Whitmer. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 512: An October of Surprises
entry.content: We talk about Trump's Covid diagnosis, voter suppression attempts and Trump's taxes. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 511: The Data is Us w/ Joe Toscano
entry.content: Ben is joined by Joe Toscano (Automating Humanity) to discuss the necessity of updating America's infrastructure, the proliferation of propaganda on social media and how cities are changing in the era of Covid. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 510: To the Victor Go the Spoils
entry.content: We discuss the passing of Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 509: The Unpolitician w/ Jo Jorgensen
entry.content: Ben is joined by the libertarian candidate for president Jo Jorgensen and they discuss her policies, campaigning during a pandemic, and her background in psychology. Find out more about Jo at Jo20.com Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 508: Triller
entry.content: Ben and Travis discuss an update to our story on inmate firefighters, the CDC's eviction moratorium and the latest social media sensation. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 507: A Tale of Two Conventions
entry.content: Ben and Travis recap the RNC and the DNC and discuss the ongoing protests in Kenosha following the police shooting of Jacob Blake. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 506: Power vs The Powerless w/ The Lucas Brothers
entry.content: Ben is joined by The Lucas Brothers to discuss their upcoming film "Judas and the Black Messiah", the life and assassination of Black Panther Fred Hampton and Hollywood's disneyfication of the civil rights movement. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 505: The Fight for the Middle
entry.content: We discuss Kamala Harris joining Biden's ticket and Trump's continuing attacks on the USPS. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 504: Scoochin for a Mnuchin
entry.content: We cover the 4 executive orders signed by Trump this week, the Beirut explosion and Biden's latest gaffe. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 503: The HEELS Act
entry.content: We discuss the HEALS act, Congress's big tech hearing, and how the pandemic is worsening the affordable housing crisis. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 502: Mr. Makes Things Sloppy
entry.content: We discuss the ending of federal unemployment benefits and how resentment fuels Trump's base. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 501: Build Back Better
entry.content: We discuss the deployment of unmarked federal police in Portland, Biden's new campaign slogan, and a new ruling from SCOTUS on felon voting rights.

entry.title: Episode 500: Shuffle the Deck
entry.content: We discuss this week's Supreme Court rulings, the latest polling data, and how the Trump administration is encouraging brain drain by refusing foreign students visas.

entry.title: Episode 499: America's Magnificent Liberty
entry.content: We celebrate the Fourth of July by discussing Trump's rally at Mt. Rushmore, price gouging on Coronavirus treatments, and who Biden is eyeing for VP.

entry.title: Episode 498: That's So Scary!
entry.content: Ben and Travis discuss white nationalism in the military, the murder of David Patrick Underwood and racial issues with facial recognition software. Check out www.BanFacialRecognition.com to learn more and sign the petition.

entry.title: Episode 497: Subpoena Me Harder!
entry.content: Ben and Travis are joined by Brooke Rogers to discuss Trump's rally in Tulsa, new studies on the effects of armed security in schools and "The Room Where It Happened". Check out Brooke's article in the Washington Examiner, "Gathering Acorns in Quarantine"

entry.title: Episode 496: Scorched Earth Politics
entry.content: Ben and Travis discussed the toppling of Confederate statues, the trickle-down of weapons from the military to the police and the Capitol Hill Autonomous Zone.

entry.title: Episode 495: Believe What You Hear, Believe What You See
entry.content: Ben and Travis recap this past week of BLM protests, the alarming use of unidentified military and police in DC and General Mattis' condemnation of Trump.

entry.title: Episode 494: MAGA Night
entry.content: Ben and Travis cover the murder of George Floyd, the resulting protests, and Trump advocating for violence against US citizens.

entry.title: Episode 493: Victim in Chief
entry.content: Ben and Travis discuss the HEROES Act, Biden's latest gaffe and Amazon cutting employee's hazard pay.

entry.title: Best of Top Hat: Marianne Williamson
entry.content: We revisit our 2019 interview with author, spiritualist and politician Marianne Williamson. Listen to the full episode! Search for Episode 451: The Politics of Love.

entry.title: Episode 492: A Tyrant You Can Trust with Vermin Supreme
entry.content: Ben and Travis are joined by presidential candidate and activist Vermin Supreme and they talk about his Baltimore beginnings, running as a libertarian and the importance of being in on the joke. Learn more about Vermin's campaign at VerminSupreme2020.com

entry.title: Best of Top Hat: Ken Bone
entry.content: We revisit our 2019 interview with Ken Bone and discuss social media negativity bleeding into politics, Ken's experience with becoming a meme and who he's eyeing for 2020. Listen to the rest of the episode! Search for Episode 441: Failing Up

entry.title: Episode 491: Winners Write History
entry.content: Ben and Travis discuss the failed assassination attempt on Nicolás Maduro, New York City targeting people of color for social distancing violations and a Supreme Court toilet flush.

entry.title: Best of Top Hat: Joe Toscano
entry.content: We revisit our interview with Joe Toscano from Episode 418: Clunky Titanic. We discuss Joe's book "Automating Humanity", UBI and a lack of federal oversight in the tech industry. Visit Joe's non-profit DesignGood.tech to learn more about better business practices on the internet.

entry.title: Episode 490: The Long Game
entry.content: Ben and Travis discuss Georgia reopening businesses, Hillary Clinton's endorsement, and Tara Reade's sexual assault allegations against Biden.

entry.title: Best of Top Hat: Ben Westhoff
entry.content: We revisit our interview from Episode 403: Fentanyl Inc with writer Ben Westhoff and we discuss the opioid crisis, big pharma and Ben's book "Fentanyl Inc".

entry.title: Episode 489: Never Tell
entry.content: Ben and Travis talk astroturfing, big businesses exploiting loopholes in small business relief funds and Biden's lackluster response to Coronavirus.

entry.title: Best of Top Hat: Andrew Yang
entry.content: We revisit our interview with Andrew Yang! To listen to the whole episode search for Episode 431: Nothing is on the Level.

entry.title: Episode 488: The Politics of Spite
entry.content: We cover the protests in Michigan, states making regional Coronavirus pacts, and Trump withdrawing funding from the WHO. We are then joined by David Daley to discuss his work covering gerrymandering and redistricting.

entry.title: Best of Top Hat: You Have the Key with Marc Mero
entry.content: We revisit our episode with Marc Mero and we discuss Marc's post-wrestling career as a motivational speaker, the challenges and rewards in connecting with today's youth and the bright futures for the new generation of retired wrestlers. For more information about Marc's motivational programs, visit https://thinkpoz.org

entry.title: Episode 487: The Name of the Game
entry.content: Ben and Travis cover the Wisconsin primary, small businesses getting left behind by banks, and Coronavirus conspiracy theories.

entry.title: Episode 486: Volunteerism is Resistance
entry.content: Ben and Travis breakdown the politicians profiteering from Coronavirus, Tara Reid's allegations against Joe Biden and Midwestern primary polling data They are then joined by Liz Baldwin and Morgan Sykes of Corona Couriers, who deliver supplies to at-risk and homebound people. Support Corona Couriers! Email coronacourier@protonmail.com or donate via Venmo @Sasha-Verma

entry.title: Episode 485: No Tragedy Goes Unused
entry.content: Ben and Travis unpack the grim ways the Coronavirus is allowing the Department of Justice to expand their powers and how the $2 trillion stimulus bill benefits corporations more than the American people. Join us in donating to One Fair Wage or the Restaurant Workers’ Community Foundation to help the unemployed.

entry.title: Episode 484: Silver Linings
entry.content: Ben and Travis catch you up on Covid-19, the death throes of the Sander's campaign and the republican party pivoting to endorse UBI. Check out Ben's documentary Hail Yourself America!

entry.title: Episode 483: We Didn't Start the Fire
entry.content: Ben, Travis and special co-host Travis Irvine (Hail Yourself America) are joined by Morgan Harper, a candidate for Ohio's 3rd district, to discuss gerrymandering, millennials running for office and the new wave of young progressives running against the democratic establishment. Learn more about Morgan's campaign at MorganHarper.org

entry.title: Episode 482: The Malarkey Has Hit the Fan
entry.content: Ben and Travis do a roundup of all the upsets from the past week, from Biden's sweep on Super Tuesday to the abrupt narrowing of the democratic field.

entry.title: Episode 481: Trim the Fat
entry.content: Ben and Travis discuss the South Carolina primary results, the Afghan peace plan and Pence taking the lead on the government's response to the Coronavirus.

entry.title: Episode 480: The Gloves Are Off
entry.content: Ben and Travis discuss all the political action occurring in Nevada this week, from the debate to the caucus results.

entry.title: Episode 479: Dirty Tricks w/ Dylan Bank
entry.content: Ben and Travis sit down with filmmaker Dylan Bank to discuss his documentary "Get Me Roger Stone".
